title: A User-Driven Framework for Regulating and Auditing Social Media. (arXiv:2304.10525v1 [cs.CY])
abstract: People form judgments and make decisions based on the information that they observe. A growing portion of that information is not only provided, but carefully curated by social media platforms. Although lawmakers largely agree that platforms should not operate without any oversight, there is little consensus on how to regulate social media. There is consensus, however, that creating a strict, global standard of "acceptable" content is untenable (e.g., in the US, it is incompatible with Section 230 of the Communications Decency Act and the First Amendment).  In this work, we propose that algorithmic filtering should be regulated with respect to a flexible, user-driven baseline. We provide a concrete framework for regulating and auditing a social media platform according to such a baseline. tldr: 该论文提出了一个用户驱动的社交媒体调控和审计框架，旨在解决社交媒体平台内容审查管理问题。该框架通过基准提要对算法过滤进行调控，保证用户看到的内容不偏离基准太多。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a user-driven framework for regulating and auditing social media platforms to address the issue of content moderation. The framework regulates algorithmic filtering with respect to a flexible user-driven baseline and ensures that users are presented with content that does not deviate too much from this baseline, as guaranteed by a baseline feed.
